All functions

e_bestsubset()

Best subset selection returns results sorted by BIC

e_bs_one_samp_dist()

Title

e_bs_two_samp_diff_dist()

Title

e_headtail()

Print head and tail of a data.frame

e_is_error()

check a function and if there's an error return an indication that we can ifelse() to either run for real or skip

e_kable_latex()

Title

e_linear_interpolation()

Linear interpolation and extrapolation of y conditional on spacing of x

e_lm_diag_plots()

lm_diag_plots() is a general function for plotting residual diagnostics for an lm() object By: Prof. Erik B. Erhardt, UNM Statistics, erike@stat.unm.edu, StatAcumen.com https://statacumen.com/teaching/ada2/ 05/26/2021

e_lm_power()

Multiple regression power analysis

e_message_capture()

Capture a message, warning, or error to take actions

e_mnv_norm_qqplot()

Title

e_plot_corr_ellipse()

Title

e_plot_longitudinal()

Longitudinal interaction plots

e_plot_missing()

Plots missing data in a data.frame, possibly grouped by one variable and sorted by a second.

e_plot_mod_contrasts()

Compute and plot all contrasts and test results from a linear model by automating the use of emmeans tables and plots. Variable labels can be provided by labelling your data with the labelled::var_label() command.

e_plot_ttest_pval()

e_plot_ttest_pval Plot the result of a t-test by shading the p-value area under the t-distribution

e_pval_stars()

Return star symbols for ranges between a set of p-values, or any set of numbers

e_roc_gg()

A function to calculate ROC curve, calculate area under the curve (AUC), calculate the optimal threshold, plot the curve, and classify the peaks.

e_tab_sum()

e_tab_sum create a frequency/proportion table by a set of variables

e_ttest_alt_hyp_text()

e_ttest_alt_hyp_text is modified code from stats::print.htest to return text of alternative hypothesis

hello()

Hello, World!
